newsitem.title: USA: Court okays $35 mln DIP financing for McCrory Corp.
newsitem.headline: Court okays $35 mln DIP financing for McCrory Corp.

text.p: McCrory Corp, a retailer operating in Chapter 11 bankruptcy since 1992, said Thursday that the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in the Southern District of New York has approved a previously-announced 16-month agreement with privately-held Foothill Capital Corp for $35 million of debtor-in-possession (DIP) financing.
The company said the proceeds will be used, among other purposes, to repay $11 million in DIP financing from another lender, and for ongoing capital needs.
Advances by Foothill under the DIP financing, said the company, will be secured by super priority liens on substantially all of its assets.
